references.paper_title: A closer look at memorization in deep networks
references.reason: This paper provides a foundational understanding of memorization in deep learning, crucial for analyzing the impact of noisy labels and overfitting.

references.paper_title: Understanding deep learning requires rethinking generalization
references.reason: This paper challenges the conventional understanding of generalization in deep learning, essential context for addressing noisy label issues that impact generalization performance.
This is a foundational paper on noisy label learning, introducing the generalized cross-entropy loss function and setting the stage for many subsequent works.

references.paper_title: Making deep neural networks robust to label noise: A loss correction approach
references.reason: This paper significantly contributes to the field by proposing a loss correction approach that tackles label noise and improves the robustness of deep neural networks.

references.paper_title: Provably end-to-end label-noise learning without anchor points
references.reason: This paper addresses the limitations of prior works by providing a provably correct end-to-end method for learning with noisy labels without relying on anchor points, which improves upon earlier approaches.
